attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Somaliland was given independence by Britain, before being united with Somalia (ex-Italian Somalia) under the Siad Barre regime.  
On the fall of the dictator in 1991, Somaliland again declared its independence.  It has since built a largely peaceful, tribal/democratic society.  This is based on a democratically elected lower house, and a tribally selected upper house.  
This is in marked contrast to (Italian) Somalia, and to Puntland - both failed states. 
The Somaliland navy has completely controlled piracy in its national waters, and has offered base facilities and cooperation to the international anti-piracy forces.  
It is time the UK recognised its former colony as a successful, independent state and as a partner.
